title: Use meaningful headings
description: Headings must be descriptive and reflect the structure of the document. Avoid vague titles.
code_smells: Headings that do not reflect document content
rule_instructions: Be forgiving. 'Objective' or 'Introduction' is completely valid.

title: Link references should be descriptive
description: Links must use meaningful text instead of raw URLs or vague phrases like 'click here'.
rule_instructions: If a bare URL is acceptable in context (e.g., reference list), do not raise a violation.

title: Consistent code block formatting
description: Code snippets must use fenced code blocks with language identifiers where applicable.
code_smells: Inline code used for multi-line snippets
Missing language identifier for fenced blocks
rule_instructions: Be forgiving for short examples where language identifiers add no value.

title: Maintain proper header hierarchy
description: Headings must follow a logical hierarchy (e.g., # -> ## --> ###) without skipping levels unnecessarily.
rule_instructions: Never raise this more than once per markdown document.

title: Include a table of contents for long documents
description: Documents longer than a few sections should include a table of contents.
code_smells: Long documents without a table of contents or TOC generator
rule_instructions: Do not enforce for short documents. Only raise when navigation clearly suffers.

title: Ensure readability and grammar
description: Markdown content must be written in clear, grammatically correct language.
rule_instructions: Do not nitpick. Only raise when the readability of grammar is very bad. If you see this in a document more than 3 times, raise it as 1 consolidated comment at the top of the document instead of leaving many comments.
